an10.76:1.1: “Bhikkhus, if three things were not found, the Realized One, the Arahant, the fully awakened Buddha would not arise in the world, and the teaching-and-discipline proclaimed by the Realized One would not shine in the world.
an10.76:1.4: If these three things were not found, the Realized One, the Arahant, the fully awakened Buddha would not arise in the world, and the teaching-and-discipline proclaimed by the Realized One would not shine in the world.
an10.76:1.5: But since these three things are found, the Realized One, the Arahant, the fully awakened Buddha arises in the world, and the teaching-and-discipline proclaimed by the Realized One shines in the world.
an10.76:2.1: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up birth, aging, and death.
an10.76:2.4: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up birth, aging, and death.
an10.76:3.1: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up passion, aversion, and muddledness.
an10.76:3.3: Personality-view, doubt, and the grasping at virtue-and-duty.
an10.76:3.4: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up passion, aversion, and muddledness.
an10.76:4.1: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up personality-view, doubt, and the grasping at virtue-and-duty.
an10.76:4.3: not-through-the-origin attention, following a wrong path, and timidity of mind.
an10.76:4.4: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up personality-view, doubt, and the grasping at virtue-and-duty.
an10.76:5.1: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up not-through-the-origin attention, following a wrong path, and timidity of mind.
an10.76:5.3: Muddled recollection, unawareness, and scatteredness of mind.
an10.76:5.4: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up not-through-the-origin attention, following a wrong path, and timidity of mind.
an10.76:6.1: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up muddled recollection, unawareness, and scatteredness of mind.
an10.76:6.3: Not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the noble teaching, and a fault-finding mind.
an10.76:6.4: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up muddled recollection, unawareness, and scatteredness of mind.
an10.76:7.1: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the noble teaching, and a fault-finding mind.
an10.76:7.3: Restlessness, lack of restraint, and lack of virtue.
an10.76:7.4: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the noble teaching, and a fault-finding mind.
an10.76:8.1: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and lack of virtue.
an10.76:8.4: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and lack of virtue.
an10.76:9.1: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
an10.76:9.3: Disrespect, being hard to admonish, and bad friendship.
an10.76:9.4: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
an10.76:10.1: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up disrespect, being hard to admonish, and bad friendship.
an10.76:10.3: Lack of shame, lack of remorse [of wrongdoing], and carelessness.
an10.76:10.4: Without giving up these three things, one cannot give up disrespect, being hard to admonish, and bad friendship.
an10.76:11.1: Bhikkhus, someone who lacks shame and dread [of wrongdoing] is careless.
an10.76:11.2: Being careless, they cannot give up disrespect, being hard to admonish, and bad friendship.
an10.76:11.3: Having bad friendships, they cannot give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
an10.76:11.4: Being lazy, they cannot give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and lack of virtue.
an10.76:11.5: Being unvirtuous, they cannot give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the noble teaching, and a fault-finding mind.
an10.76:11.6: Having a fault-finding mind, they cannot give up muddled recollection, unawareness, and scatteredness of mind.
an10.76:11.7: Having a scattered mind, they cannot give up not-through-the-origin attention, following a wrong path, and timidity of mind.
an10.76:11.8: Having a timid mind, they cannot give up personality-view, doubt, and the grasping at virtue-and-duty.
an10.76:11.9: Having doubts, they cannot give up passion, aversion, and muddledness.
an10.76:11.10: Without giving up passion, aversion, and muddledness, they cannot give up birth, aging, and death.
an10.76:12.1: Having given up these three things, one can give up birth, aging, and death.
an10.76:12.4: Having given up these three things, one can give up birth, aging, and death.
an10.76:13.1: Having given up these three things, one can give up passion, aversion, and muddledness.
an10.76:13.3: Personality-view, doubt, and the grasping at virtue-and-duty.
an10.76:13.4: Having given up these three things, one can give up passion, aversion, and muddledness.
an10.76:14.1: Having given up these three things, one can give up personality-view, doubt, and the grasping at virtue-and-duty.
an10.76:14.3: not-through-the-origin attention, following a wrong path, and timidity of mind.
an10.76:14.4: Having given up these three things, one can give up personality-view, doubt, and the grasping at virtue-and-duty.
an10.76:15.1: Having given up these three things, one can give up not-through-the-origin attention, following a wrong path, and timidity of mind.
an10.76:15.3: Muddled recollection, unawareness, and scatteredness of mind.
an10.76:15.4: Having given up these three things, one can give up not-through-the-origin attention, following a wrong path, and timidity of mind.
an10.76:16.1: Having given up these three things, one can give up muddled recollection, unawareness, and scatteredness of mind.
an10.76:16.3: Not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the noble teaching, and a fault-finding mind.
an10.76:16.4: Having given up these three things, one can give up muddled recollection, unawareness, and scatteredness of mind.
an10.76:17.1: Having given up these three things, one can give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the noble teaching, and a fault-finding mind.
an10.76:17.3: Restlessness, lack of restraint, and lack of virtue.
an10.76:17.4: Having given up these three things, one can give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the noble teaching, and a fault-finding mind.
an10.76:18.1: Having given up these three things, one can give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and lack of virtue.
an10.76:18.4: Having given up these three things, one can give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and lack of virtue.
an10.76:19.1: Having given up these three things, one can give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
an10.76:19.3: Disrespect, being hard to admonish, and bad friendship.
an10.76:19.4: Having given up these three things, one can give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
an10.76:20.1: Having given up these three things, one can give up disrespect, being hard to admonish, and bad friendship.
an10.76:20.3: Lack of shame, lack of remorse [of wrongdoing], and carelessness.
an10.76:20.4: Having given up these three things, one can give up disrespect, being hard to admonish, and bad friendship.
an10.76:21.1: Bhikkhus, someone who has a sense of shame and dread [of wrongdoing] is heedful.
an10.76:21.2: Being heedful, they can give up disrespect, being hard to admonish, and bad friendship.
an10.76:21.3: Having good friends, they can give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
an10.76:21.4: Being effortful, they can give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and lack of virtue.
an10.76:21.5: Being virtuous, they can give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the noble teaching, and a fault-finding mind.
an10.76:21.6: Without a fault-finding mind, they can give up muddled recollection, unawareness, and scatteredness of mind.
an10.76:21.7: With a mind that is not scattered, they can give up not-through-the-origin attention, following a wrong path, and timidity of mind.
an10.76:21.8: With a mind that is not timid, they can give up personality-view, doubt, and the grasping at virtue-and-duty.
an10.76:21.9: Being free from doubt, they can give up passion, aversion, and muddledness.
an10.76:21.10: Giving up passion, aversion, and muddledness, they can give up birth, aging, and death.”
